{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2020",
    "module": "CommonJS",
    "lib": ["ES2020", "DOM"],
    "strict": true,
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "resolveJsonModule": true,
    "outDir": "./dist",
    "rootDir": "."
  },
  "include": ["src", "tests", "playwright.config.ts"]
}

# proj-1756645040104 - Playwright UI Automation (TypeScript)

This project contains Playwright tests in TypeScript to validate the login flow of http://www.saucedemo.com using the Page Object Model (POM) and SOLID design principles.

Credentials used in tests:
- username: standard_user
- password: secret_sauce

Prerequisites:
- Node.js >= 16

Setup & run:
1. Install dependencies:
   npm install

   The project runs a playright install step automatically (prepare script) to download browsers. If you encounter issues, run:
   npx playwright install --with-deps

2. Run tests:
   npm test

Useful commands:
- npm run test:headed  -> run tests with visible browser
- npm run test:debug   -> run Playwright in debug mode

Project structure:
- src/pages - Page Object Model classes
- tests - Playwright test files
- playwright.config.ts - Playwright configuration

Design notes:
- Each page object has a single responsibility and exposes high-level actions.
- Tests consume page objects to perform actions and assertions.

node_modules/
playwright-report/
test-results/
dist/
.env
.vscode/
.idea/
coverage/

# proj-1756645040104

Playwright TypeScript project containing two negative tests for https://www.saucedemo.com.

How to run:

1. npm install
2. npm test

Notes:
- The project uses the Page Object Model under `src/pages`.
- Tests are located under `tests/`.
- The postinstall script will attempt to install Playwright browsers automatically (`playwright install --with-deps`).

Tests included:
- invalid credentials
- locked out user

Proj-1756843281583 - Selenium C# UI tests for https://www.saucedemo.com/

This project contains 4 automated UI tests (2 positive, 2 negative) using Selenium WebDriver with NUnit.

Prerequisites:
- .NET 7 SDK installed: https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download

How to run:
1. Restore packages:
   dotnet restore

2. Run tests:
   dotnet test --logger:trx

Notes:
- Tests run Chrome in headless mode by default. If you need to see the browser, edit tests/Helpers/BaseTest.cs to remove headless arguments.
- The ChromeDriver binary is provided via the Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver NuGet package.

Test cases included:
- Positive: Login_WithValidCredentials_ShouldNavigateToInventory
- Positive: AddProductToCart_WithValidCredentials_ShouldIncreaseCartBadge
- Negative: Login_WithInvalidPassword_ShouldShowError
- Negative: Login_WithEmptyPassword_ShouldShowError

Credentials used (as requested):
- username: standard_user
- password: secret_sauce

Folder layout:
- src/Pages/  -> Page Object Model classes
- tests/     -> NUnit test classes and test helpers

Enjoy!

<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net7.0</TargetFramework>
    <IsPackable>false</IsPackable>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
    <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver" Version="4.14.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.Support" Version="4.14.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver" Version="119.0.6045.140" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.13.3" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit3TestAdapter" Version="4.5.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk" Version="17.9.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="DotNetSeleniumExtras.WaitHelpers" Version="3.11.0" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <None Update="README.md">
      <Pack>True</Pack>
      <PackagePath></PackagePath>
    </None>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>

Proj-1756843281583 - Selenium C# UI tests for https://www.saucedemo.com/

This project contains 4 automated UI tests (2 positive, 2 negative) using Selenium WebDriver with NUnit.

Prerequisites:
- .NET 7 SDK installed: https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download

How to run:
1. Restore packages:
   dotnet restore

2. Run tests:
   dotnet test --logger:trx

Notes:
- Tests run Chrome in headless mode by default. If you need to see the browser, edit tests/Helpers/BaseTest.cs to remove headless arguments.
- The ChromeDriver binary is provided via the Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver NuGet package.

Test cases included:
- Positive: Login_WithValidCredentials_ShouldNavigateToInventory
- Positive: AddProductToCart_WithValidCredentials_ShouldIncreaseCartBadge
- Negative: Login_WithInvalidPassword_ShouldShowError
- Negative: Login_WithEmptyPassword_ShouldShowError

Credentials used (as requested):
- username: standard_user
- password: secret_sauce

Folder layout:
- src/Pages/  -> Page Object Model classes
- tests/     -> NUnit test classes and test helpers

Enjoy!

filesAfter.content:
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net7.0</TargetFramework>
    <IsPackable>false</IsPackable>
    <LangVersion>latest</LangVersion>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <!-- Test framework and adapter -->
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.13.3" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit3TestAdapter" Version="4.5.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk" Version="17.9.0" />

    <!-- Selenium WebDriver -->
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver" Version="4.11.0" />
    <!-- ChromeDriver package provides the chromedriver executable appropriate for platform -->
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver" Version="118.0.5993.9000" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>

# proj-1756843281583

Selenium UI automation project in C# using NUnit and Page Object Model.

Prerequisites:
- .NET SDK 7.0 or later (dotnet)
- Google Chrome browser installed (matching a compatible chromedriver will be provided via NuGet package)

How to run:
1. Restore dependencies:
   dotnet restore

2. Run tests:
   dotnet test

Notes:
- The project uses Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver NuGet package to provide the chromedriver executable. If the included chromedriver version is incompatible with your local Chrome, update the Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver package version in the .csproj or install a matching local chromedriver and adjust PATH.
- Tests are located under the "tests/" folder and follow the Page Object Model with page classes in "src/Pages".

bin/
obj/
.vs/
*.user
*.suo
TestResults/
*.nupkg
.nuget/

filesAfter.content:
// Project: JavaSelenium
# JavaSelenium

This project contains Selenium automated tests for SauceDemo.com.

## Prerequisites
- Java
- Maven

## Running Tests
1. Clone the repository.
2. Navigate to the project directory.
3. Run `mvn clean test` to execute the test cases.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.example</groupId>
    <artifactId>JavaSelenium</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
            <artifactId>selenium-java</artifactId>
            <version>4.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.testcontainers</groupId>
            <artifactId>testcontainers</artifactId>
            <version>1.15.3</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.12</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.22.2</version>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net6.0</TargetFramework>
    <GenerateAssemblyInfo>false</GenerateAssemblyInfo>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver" Version="4.5.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver" Version="113.0.5672.63" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.13.3" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit3TestAdapter" Version="3.17.0" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>

# CharpSelenium

## Overview
CharpSelenium is a simple Selenium WebDriver project in C# for automating test cases on the Sauce Demo website. This project demonstrates positive and negative test scenarios for user login.

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites
- .NET 6 SDK
- Visual Studio or any compatible IDE

### Installation
1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd CharpSelenium
   ```
2. Restore the dependencies:
   ```bash
   dotnet restore
   ```
3. Run Tests:
   ```bash
   dotnet test
   ```

## Test Cases
- **Positive Test Case:** Valid user login.
- **Negative Test Cases:** Invalid username and invalid password.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>net6.0</TargetFramework>
    <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="RestSharp" Version="108.0.2" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.13.3" />
    <PackageReference Include="NUnit3TestAdapter" Version="4.2.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk" Version="17.2.0" />
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>

# CSharpUnitTests

This project demonstrates a simple API test using RestSharp in C#/.NET.

## Setup

1. Ensure you have .NET 6.0 SDK installed.
2. Restore dependencies and build the project:

```shell
cd CSharpUnitTests
 dotnet restore
 dotnet build
```

## Running Tests

Execute the tests using the `dotnet test` command:

```shell
dotnet test
```

This will run the API tests for the RESTful API.
